name: id
desc: Component ID, not specified by default. If specified, it can be used to refer the component in option or API.

name: orient
desc:
The layout orientation of toolbox's icon.

Options:
+ 'horizontal'
+ 'vertical'

name: itemGap
desc: The gap between each icon of toolbox. It is horizontal gap in horizontal layout, while vertical gap in vertical layout.

name: showTitle
desc: Whether to show the title of each tool icon when mouse hovers.

name: feature

children.name: saveAsImage
children.desc: Save as image.

children.name: type
children.desc:
File suffix of the image saved.

+ If the `renderer` is set to be `'canvas'` when chart [initialized](api.html#echarts.init) (default), then `'png'` (default) and `'jpeg'` are supported.
+ If the `renderer` is set to be `'svg'` when when chart [initialized](api.html#echarts.init), then only `'svg'` is supported for `type` (`'svg'` type is supported since `v4.8.0`).

children.name: name
children.desc: Name to save the image, whose default value is [title.text](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#title.text).

children.name: backgroundColor
children.desc: Background color to save the image, whose default value is [backgroundColor](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#backgroundColor). If `backgroundColor` is not set, white color is used.

children.name: connectedBackgroundColor
children.desc: When [echarts.connect](api.html#echarts.connect) is used to connect the interaction of multiple chart series, they will all be included in the exported image. This option sets the background color between these charts.

children.name: excludeComponents
children.desc: Components to be excluded when export. By default, toolbox is excluded.

children.name: show
children.desc: Whether to show the tool.

children.name: title
children.desc:
#### icon


It can be set to an image with `'image://url'` , in which URL is the link to an image, or `dataURI` of an image.


An image URL example:

```
'image://http://xxx.xxx.xxx/a/b.png'
```

A `dataURI` example:

```
'image://data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhEAAQAMQAAORHHOVSKudfOulrSOp3WOyDZu6QdvCchPGolfO0o/XBs/fNwfjZ0frl3/zy7////wAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACH5BAkAABAALAAAAAAQABAAAAVVICSOZGlCQAosJ6mu7fiyZeKqNKToQGDsM8hBADgUXoGAiqhSvp5QAnQKGIgUhwFUYLCVDFCrKUE1lBavAViFIDlTImbKC5Gm2hB0SlBCBMQiB0UjIQA7'
```


Icons can be set to arbitrary vector path via `'path://'` in ECharts. As compared with a raster image, vector paths prevent jagging and blurring when scaled, and have better control over changing colors. The size of the vector icon will be adapted automatically. Refer to [SVG PathData](http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/paths.html#PathData) for more information about the format of the path. You may export vector paths from tools like Adobe

For example:

```
'path://M30.9,53.2C16.8,53.2,5.3,41.7,5.3,27.6S16.8,2,30.9,2C45,2,56.4,13.5,56.4,27.6S45,53.2,30.9,53.2z M30.9,3.5C17.6,3.5,6.8,14.4,6.8,27.6c0,13.3,10.8,24.1,24.101,24.1C44.2,51.7,55,40.9,55,27.6C54.9,14.4,44.1,3.5,30.9,3.5z M36.9,35.8c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H36c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1V35.8z M27.8,35.8 c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H27c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1L27.8,35.8L27.8,35.8z'
```

children.name: iconStyle
children.desc:
The style setting of save as image icon. Since icon label is displayed only when hovering on the icon, the label configuration options are available under `emphasis`.


##### color(Color)=none

color.



> Color can be represented in RGB, for example `'rgb(128, 128, 128)'`. RGBA can be used when you need alpha channel, for example `'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)'`. You may also use hexadecimal format, for example `'#ccc'`. Gradient color and texture are also supported besides single colors.
> ```js
> // Linear gradient. First four parameters are x0, y0, x2, and y2, each ranged from 0 to 1, standing for percentage in the bounding box. If global is `true`, then the first four parameters are in absolute pixel positions.
> color: {
>     type: 'linear',
>     x: 0,
>     y: 0,
>     x2: 0,
>     y2: 1,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Radial gradient. First three parameters are x and y positions of center, and radius, similar to linear gradient.
> color: {
>     type: 'radial',
>     x: 0.5,
>     y: 0.5,
>     r: 0.5,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Fill with texture
> color: {
>     image: imageDom, // HTMLImageElement, and HTMLCanvasElement are supported, while string path is not supported
>     repeat: 'repeat' // whether to repeat texture, whose value can be repeat-x, repeat-y, or no-repeat
> }
> ```

children.name: borderColor
children.desc: border color, whose format is similar to that of `color`.

children.name: borderWidth
children.desc: border width. No border when it is set to be 0.

children.name: borderType
children.desc: Border type, which can be `'solid'`, `'dashed'`, or `'dotted'`. `'solid'` by default.

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```js
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

children.name: opacity
children.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

children.name: textFill
children.desc: Fill color of text. If it's not set, it will use in the order of icon's fill color, stroke color, and `'#000'`.

children.name: pixelRatio
children.desc: Resolution ratio to save image, whose default value is that of the container. Values larger than 1 (e.g.: 2) is supported when you need higher resolution.

children.desc: Restore configuration item.

##### color(Color)=none

color.



> Color can be represented in RGB, for example `'rgb(128, 128, 128)'`. RGBA can be used when you need alpha channel, for example `'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)'`. You may also use hexadecimal format, for example `'#ccc'`. Gradient color and texture are also supported besides single colors.
> ```js
> // Linear gradient. First four parameters are x0, y0, x2, and y2, each ranged from 0 to 1, standing for percentage in the bounding box. If global is `true`, then the first four parameters are in absolute pixel positions.
> color: {
>     type: 'linear',
>     x: 0,
>     y: 0,
>     x2: 0,
>     y2: 1,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Radial gradient. First three parameters are x and y positions of center, and radius, similar to linear gradient.
> color: {
>     type: 'radial',
>     x: 0.5,
>     y: 0.5,
>     r: 0.5,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Fill with texture
> color: {
>     image: imageDom, // HTMLImageElement, and HTMLCanvasElement are supported, while string path is not supported
>     repeat: 'repeat' // whether to repeat texture, whose value can be repeat-x, repeat-y, or no-repeat
> }
> ```

>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Radial gradient. First three parameters are x and y positions of center, and radius, similar to linear gradient.
> color: {
>     type: 'radial',
>     x: 0.5,
>     y: 0.5,
>     r: 0.5,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Fill with texture
> color: {
>     image: imageDom, // HTMLImageElement, and HTMLCanvasElement are supported, while string path is not supported
>     repeat: 'repeat' // whether to repeat texture, whose value can be repeat-x, repeat-y, or no-repeat
> }
> ```

children.name: borderColor
children.desc: border color, whose format is similar to that of `color`.

children.name: borderWidth
children.desc: border width. No border when it is set to be 0.

children.name: borderType
children.desc: Border type, which can be `'solid'`, `'dashed'`, or `'dotted'`. `'solid'` by default.

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```js
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

children.name: opacity
children.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

children.name: textPosition
children.desc: Text position: `'left'` / `'right'` / `'top'` / `'bottom'`.

children.name: textFill
children.desc: Fill color of text. If it's not set, it will use in the order of icon's fill color, stroke color, and `'#000'`.

children.name: textAlign
children.desc: Text align: `'left'` / `'center'` / `'right'`.

children.name: textBackgroundColor
children.desc: Text background color.

children.name: textBorderRadius
children.desc: Border radius of text area.

children.name: textPadding
children.desc: Padding of text area.

children.name: icon
children.desc: the different types of icon path , which could be configurated individually.

children.name: line
children.desc:
It can be set to an image with `'image://url'` , in which URL is the link to an image, or `dataURI` of an image.


An image URL example:

```
'image://http://xxx.xxx.xxx/a/b.png'
```

A `dataURI` example:

```
'image://data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhEAAQAMQAAORHHOVSKudfOulrSOp3WOyDZu6QdvCchPGolfO0o/XBs/fNwfjZ0frl3/zy7////wAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACH5BAkAABAALAAAAAAQABAAAAVVICSOZGlCQAosJ6mu7fiyZeKqNKToQGDsM8hBADgUXoGAiqhSvp5QAnQKGIgUhwFUYLCVDFCrKUE1lBavAViFIDlTImbKC5Gm2hB0SlBCBMQiB0UjIQA7'
```


Icons can be set to arbitrary vector path via `'path://'` in ECharts. As compared with a raster image, vector paths prevent jagging and blurring when scaled, and have better control over changing colors. The size of the vector icon will be adapted automatically. ```

children.name: title
children.desc: Title for different types, can be configured seperately.

children.name: option
children.desc: Configuration item for each type, which will be used when switching to certain type.

children.name: seriesIndex
children.desc: Series list for each type.

children.name: brush
children.desc:
Brush-selecting icon.

It can also be configured at [brush.toolbox](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#brush.toolbox).

children.name: type
children.desc:
Icons used, whose values are:

+ `'rect'`: Enabling selecting with rectangle area.
+ `'polygon'`: Enabling selecting with any shape.
+ `'lineX'`: Enabling horizontal selecting.
+ `'lineY'`: Enabling vertical selecting.
+ `'keep'`: Switching between *single selecting* and *multiple selecting*. The latter one can select multiple areas, while the former one cancels previous selection.
+ `'clear'`: Clearing all selection.

children.name: icon
children.desc: Icon path for each icon.

children.name: clear
children.desc:
It can be set to an image with `'image://url'` , in which URL is the link to an image, or `dataURI` of an image.


An image URL example:

```
'image://http://xxx.xxx.xxx/a/b.png'
```

A `dataURI` example:

```
'image://data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhEAAQAMQAAORHHOVSKudfOulrSOp3WOyDZu6QdvCchPGolfO0o/XBs/fNwfjZ0frl3/zy7////wAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACH5BAkAABAALAAAAAAQABAAAAVVICSOZGlCQAosJ6mu7fiyZeKqNKToQGDsM8hBADgUXoGAiqhSvp5QAnQKGIgUhwFUYLCVDFCrKUE1lBavAViFIDlTImbKC5Gm2hB0SlBCBMQiB0UjIQA7'
```


Icons can be set to arbitrary vector path via `'path://'` in ECharts. As compared with a raster image, vector paths prevent jagging and blurring when scaled, and have better control over changing colors. The size of the vector icon will be adapted automatically. Refer to [SVG PathData](http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/paths.html#PathData) for more information about the format of the path. You may export vector paths from tools like Adobe

For example:

```
'path://M30.9,53.2C16.8,53.2,5.3,41.7,5.3,27.6S16.8,2,30.9,2C45,2,56.4,13.5,56.4,27.6S45,53.2,30.9,53.2z M30.9,3.5C17.6,3.5,6.8,14.4,6.8,27.6c0,13.3,10.8,24.1,24.101,24.1C44.2,51.7,55,40.9,55,27.6C54.9,14.4,44.1,3.5,30.9,3.5z M36.9,35.8c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H36c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1V35.8z M27.8,35.8 c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H27c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1L27.8,35.8L27.8,35.8z'
```

name: iconStyle
desc:
The style setting of Shared icon. Since icon label is displayed only when hovering on the icon, the label configuration options are available under `emphasis`.


### color(Color)=none

color.



> Color can be represented in RGB, for example `'rgb(128, 128, 128)'`. RGBA can be used when you need alpha channel, for example `'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)'`. You may also use hexadecimal format, for example `'#ccc'`. Gradient color and texture are also supported besides single colors.
> ```js
> // Linear gradient. First four parameters are x0, y0, x2, and y2, each ranged from 0 to 1, standing for percentage in the bounding box. If global is `true`, then the first four parameters are in absolute pixel positions.
> color: {
>     type: 'linear',
>     x: 0,
>     y: 0,
>     x2: 0,
>     y2: 1,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Radial gradient. First three parameters are x and y positions of center, and radius, similar to linear gradient.
> color: {
>     type: 'radial',
>     x: 0.5,
>     y: 0.5,
>     r: 0.5,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Fill with texture
> color: {
>     image: imageDom, // HTMLImageElement, and HTMLCanvasElement are supported, while string path is not supported
>     repeat: 'repeat' // whether to repeat texture, whose value can be repeat-x, repeat-y, or no-repeat
> }
> ```

children.name: borderColor
children.desc: border color, whose format is similar to that of `color`.

children.name: borderWidth
children.desc: border width. No border when it is set to be 0.

children.name: borderType
children.desc: Border type, which can be `'solid'`, `'dashed'`, or `'dotted'`. `'solid'` by default.

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```js
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

children.name: opacity
children.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

name: zlevel
desc:
`zlevel` value of all graphical elements in .

`zlevel` is used to make layers with Canvas. Graphical elements with different `zlevel` values will be placed in different Canvases, which is a common optimization technique. We can put those frequently changed elements (like those with animations) to a separate `zlevel`. Notice that too many Canvases will increase memory cost, and should be used carefully on mobile phones to avoid crash.

Canvases with bigger `zlevel` will be placed on Canvases with smaller `zlevel`.

name: z
desc:
`z` value of all graphical elements in , which controls order of drawing graphical components. Components with smaller `z` values may be overwritten by those with larger `z` values.

`z` has a lower priority to `zlevel`, and will not create new Canvas.

name: left
desc:
Distance between toolbox component and the left side of the container.

`left` value can be instant pixel value like `20`; it can also be a percentage value relative to container width like `'20%'`; and it can also be `'left'`, `'center'`, or `'right'`.

If the `left` value is set to be `'left'`, `'center'`, or `'right'`, then the component will be aligned automatically based on position.

name: top
desc:
Distance between toolbox component and the top side of the container.

`top` value can be instant pixel value like `20`; it can also be a percentage value relative to container width like `'20%'`; and it can also be `'top'`, `'middle'`, or `'bottom'`.

If the `left` value is set to be `'top'`, `'middle'`, or `'bottom'`, then the component will be aligned automatically based on position.

name: right
desc:
Distance between toolbox component and the right side of the container.

`right` value can be instant pixel value like `20`; it can also be a percentage value relative to container width like `'20%'`.

Adaptive by default.

name: bottom
desc:
Distance between toolbox component and the bottom side of the container.

`bottom` value can be instant pixel value like `20`; it can also be a percentage value relative to container width like `'20%'`.

Adaptive by default.

name: width
desc: Width of toolbox component. Adaptive by default.

name: height
desc: Height of toolbox component. Adaptive by default.
